description:
Advanced analysis and evaluation of various topics and issues on health disparities of underserved ethnic or minority vulnerable populations, including intervention and policy strategies designed to improve access and quality of life through culturally competent research, education and clinical practice. 

Areas to be evaluated include the: -Historical dimensions leading to health disparities -Health disparities in urban vulnerable communities -Concepts of marginalization, race, ethnicity, class, gender and culture as it relates to health disparities -Theoretical and research approaches related to health disparities -Impact of health disparities on underserved people of color -Theoretical basis of culturally congruent research, educationand clinical practice -Assessment of culturally competent research methodologies, education education and clinical practice -Strategies for reducing health disparities in urban vulnerable communities, including building partnerships with the urban community -Health disparities as it relates to health promotion and disease prevention, early detection, screening, and treatment. -Examining policy makers who identify the research agenda forhealth disparity research
name: ADDRESSING HEALTH DISPARITIES IN URBAN VULNERABLE COMMUNITIES
